result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R Lang

records.addlTxt: Victim request to amend bond condition - Declined
Adjourned initial appearance on November 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.

10:45 AM Defendant Michael R Lang in court without counsel.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant did receive the criminal complaint. Court advises defendant of the charges. Defendant will be securing private counsel. Victim rights complied with. Victim appearing via zoom. Victim would like bond amended. Court will be addressing when the motion is filed. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael R Lang
Current: 8901 Shadetree Lane, Woodruff, WI 54568 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2022)
Prior: 8458 Balsam Drive, Unit 6, Presque Isle, WI 54557
No possession of any weapons, no contact with victim D.S. (1990), provide a written address of where you will be residing.

1:21PM Defendant Michael R Lang appeared by video, in custody with the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint. Victim rights complied with.  Victim was going to appear via zoom but has not. Court reads charges.  Attorney rights given.  State speaks to bond. Court sets bond at $5,000.00 CASH, Conditions: No possession of any weapons, no contact with victim D.S. (1990), provide a written address of where you will be residing. Bond form.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.
